page.title: 08Local facilities in Cheshunt
page.content: There is a cottage hospital with a casualty unit. The building is very old. A clinic gives mother and baby care. There are notices about help groups and family problems. There is a police station. The local policeman rides a bicycle and visits schools giving talks on road safety, local dangers and meets the children. The fire station has modern facilities and an emergency rescue service. It has many activities for the firemen like darts, snooker and a bar. The library is an old building with modern additions. It has a separate childrens library providing information books, story books and story tapes. It advertises local clubs and shows. A library van goes around villages and visits some schools each month. The O.A.P. home is a new single storey building on the estate.
